Being fit in summer has only one secret: hydration. You know what you need to take to stay hydrated? Yes, you do.

True, during the summer need more hydration. Especially if you play sports and want to avoid heat stroke. Thanks to advertising, some people think that this means taking sports drinks, sugary sodas, iced coffee and other delicacies that are loaded with sugar. This is a mistake. All you need your body is water. The remaining spare.

The first problem to drink something other than water is calories. One cappuccino are 400 calories, and contains coffee, which is a diuretic and dehydrated. It quench your thirst with a can of Coca-Cola, which contains the equivalent of six packets of sugar, only add inches to your tummy while you sunbathe. The worst is that instead of quenching thirst, sugar will give you more thirsty.
